WorkItem.Description:
I have a comboBox like so:
<ComboBox Grid.Row="2" Grid.Column="1" Name="cboILWPortfolio"
                        ItemsSource="{Binding ILWPortfolioList.ILWPortfolios}"
                        DisplayMemberPath="ILWPortfolioName"
                        SelectedValuePath="ILWPortfolioID"
                        SelectedItem="{Binding ILWPortfolioList.SelectedILWPortfolio}">
</ComboBox>
Â 
The ItemsSource is bound to an ObservableCollection.  Normally this displays a list of portfolios nicely in my dropdown list.  When I apply BureauBlue or WhistlerBlue themes, I no longer see the portfolio names.  Instead I see the Data Type of what the ComboBox ItemsSource is bound to.
WorkItem.Summary: ComboBox DisplayMemberPath binding is broken by Themes BureauBlue and WhistlerBlue

Comments.Message: Override ToString method in object in ObservableCollection

Thanks, but this has nothing to do with my ObservableCollection.  I found the line that broke DisplayMemberPath display.  If you comment out this in BureauBlue.xaml (combobox section):
 <!--<ContentPresenter x:Name="contentPresenter" Content="{TemplateBinding Content}" ContentTemplate="{TemplateBinding ContentTemplate}" HorizontalAlignment="{TemplateBinding HorizontalContentAlignment}" Margin="{TemplateBinding Padding}" />-->

and put this in instead:

<ContentPresenter HorizontalAlignment="{TemplateBinding HorizontalContentAlignment}" VerticalAlignment="{TemplateBinding VerticalContentAlignment}" Margin="5,2,0,2"/>

it will work!!

ml_black - Thanks for your post - this was driving me mad - I went away for a wekk from our project and someone sw3apped in this theme while I was away - I spent a good half day wondering why all my comboboxes were not displaying DisplayMemberPath.  The hard coded Margin you have put in might become a problem  - I suspect the original author intended Margin="{TemplateBinding Margin}"

zoltek - The problem is that the ToString() method was being used to display the combobox item and not the DisplayMemberPath as you would expect from the xaml.

Anyone - Can anyone explain what is going on under the hood here causing this?

I tested the solution that ml_black   wrote and works.
Unfortunately the Themes work in a different way to another.

Open the Bureau Blue theme file and change the following line in the comboboxitem style 

      <ContentPresenter x:Name="contentPresenter" Content="{TemplateBinding Content}" ContentTemplate="{TemplateBinding ContentTemplate}"  HorizontalAlignment="{TemplateBinding HorizontalContentAlignment}" Margin="{TemplateBinding Padding}"/>

 To
         <ContentPresenter x:Name="contentPresenter" HorizontalAlignment="{TemplateBinding HorizontalContentAlignment}" Margin="{TemplateBinding Padding}"/>
 That should retain the theme and also fix the issue. 

Thanks !!
